text: Burt C. Hopkins (born February 7, 1954) is an American philosopher and phenomenologist. He is associated with University of Lille, Summer School of Phenomenology and Phenomenological Philosophy, Ca' Foscari University of Venice, Seattle University, and the Husserl Circle.Husserl Circle. == Life == He earned his BA in philosophy from Allegheny College, MA in philosophy at Ohio University, and his Ph.D. in philosophy from DePaul University. From 1989 to 2016, he was Professor and Chair of Philosophy at Seattle University. Seattle University He is founding co-editor (with Steven Crowell) of The New Yearbook for Phenomenology and Phenomenological Philosophy. == Books == * The Origin of the Logic of Symbolic Mathematics: Edmund Husserl and Jacob Klein (Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 2011) * The Philosophy of Husserl (Chesam, UK: Acumen Press and Montreal: McGill University Press, 2010) * Intentionality in Husserl and Heidegger: The Problem of the Original Method and Phenomenon of Phenomenology (Dordrecht: Kluwer Academic Publishers, 1993) == References == Category:American philosophers
